page.title: 17Attitudes in Woburn 1
page.content: {Attitudes to Tourism} People in Woburn think that the village has changed greatly in the past few years. It now caters more for {tourists}than for the residents. Several shopkeepers disagreed with this, but the tourists provide their livelihood. Residents think that the prices are too high and they cannot afford to shop there. They do not approve of the new antique and fashion shops which have opened in recent years. The{Woburn Golf Tournaments}also attract tourists and many celebrities, but residents and shop keepers seem to approve of this. On the whole the residents welcome tourists as the livelihood of the village depends on them.
